When using this StrobeModePulseOpen as a Channel Function attribute, make sure that the attribute for the Logical Channel is set to StrobeModeShutter. In case that StrobeModeShutter already exists in the same geometry, you can use the StrobeModePulseOpen as the Logical Channel attribute.

StrobeModeRandom.definition: Strobe mode random strobe. Use this attribute together with StrobeFrequency to define the type of the shutter / strobe.
StrobeModeRandom.explanation: Use this attribute do describe a function that allows to set to shutter/strobe into a mode where the shutter into a mode of random strobing. When using this StrobeModeRandom as a Channel Function attribute, make sure that the attribute for the Logical Channel is set to StrobeModeShutter. In case that StrobeModeShutter already exists in the same geometry, you can use the StrobeModeRandom as the Logical Channel attribute.

StrobeModeRandomPulse.definition: Strobe mode random pulse. Use this attribute together with StrobeFrequency to define the type of the shutter / strobe.
StrobeModeRandomPulse.explanation: Use this attribute do describe a function that allows to set to shutter/strobe into a mode where the shutter into a mode of random pulse based strobing. When using this StrobeModeRandomPulse as a Channel Function attribute, make sure that the attribute for the Logical Channel is set to StrobeModeShutter. In case that StrobeModeShutter already exists in the same geometry, you can use the StrobeModeRandomPulse as the Logical Channel attribute.

StrobeModeRandomPulseClose.definition: Strobe mode random closing pulse. Use this attribute together with StrobeFrequency to define the type of the shutter / strobe.
StrobeModeRandomPulseClose.explanation: Use this attribute do describe a function that allows to set to shutter/strobe into a mode where the shutter pulses in random intervals with slower closing and faster opening behavior. When using this StrobeModeRandomPulseClose as a Channel Function attribute, make sure that the attribute for the Logical Channel is set to StrobeModeShutter. In case that StrobeModeShutter already exists in the same geometry, you can use the StrobeModeRandomPulseClose as the Logical Channel attribute.

StrobeModeRandomPulseOpen.definition: Strobe mode random opening pulse. Use this attribute together with StrobeFrequency to define the type of the shutter / strobe.
StrobeModeRandomPulseOpen.explanation: Use this attribute do describe a function that allows to set to shutter/strobe into a mode where the shutter pulses in random intervals with slower opening and faster closing behavior. When using this StrobeModeRandomPulseOpen as a Channel Function attribute, make sure that the attribute for the Logical Channel is set to StrobeModeShutter. In case that StrobeModeShutter already exists in the same geometry, you can use the StrobeModeRandomPulseOpen as the Logical Channel attribute.

StrobeModeShutter.definition: Strobe mode shutter. Use this attribute together with StrobeFrequency to define the type of the shutter / strobe.
StrobeModeShutter.explanation: Use this attribute do describe a function that allows to set to shutter/strobe into a Shutter Mode.

StrobeModeStrobe.definition: Strobe mode strobe. Use this attribute together with StrobeFrequency to define the type of the shutter / strobe.
StrobeModeStrobe.explanation: Use this attribute do describe a function that allows to set to shutter/strobe into a Strobe Mode. When using this StrobeModeStrobe as a Channel Function attribute, make sure that the attribute for the Logical Channel is set to StrobeModeShutter. In case that StrobeModeShutter already exists in the same geometry, you can use the StrobeModeStrobe as the Logical Channel attribute.

StrobeRate.definition: Controls the time between strobe flashes.
StrobeRate.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that can adjust the time between individual flashes.

Tilt.definition: Controls the fixture's upward and the downward movement (vertical axis).
Tilt.explanation: TILT is one part of the movement that usually controls the vertical movement .In regards to the fixture the Attribute of TILT will control the overall rotation around the yoke-axis of the fixture. If the fixture is mounted hanging it usually moves around the x-axis or y-axis, depending on the PAN. TILT can also be used for virtual control of media server layers or other objects in virtual 3D environments. Usually TILT is used in relation with PAN.

TiltMode.definition: Selects fixture's pan mode. Selects between a limited tilt range (e.g. -130 to 130) or a continuous tilt range.
TiltMode.explanation: For devices that allow different modes of tilt behavior, use this attribute to describe the behavior.

TiltReset.explanation: This attribute is describing a function that allows the operator to trigger an internal reset of the fixture's tilt.

TiltRotate.definition: Controls the speed of the fixture's continuous tilt movement (vertical axis).
TiltRotate.explanation: For fixtures with the ability to have a continuous tilt rotation, the “Tilt Rotate” control defines how fast (speed) a fixture can rotate about the tilt axis. Usually, the vertical axis.

Tint.definition: Controls the fixture's "Correct green to magenta" wheel or mixing system.
Tint.explanation: Choose this attribute to control a function that adjusts the Green/Magenta shift of a fixture's light output.

UVStability.definition: Settings for UV stability color behavior.
UVStability.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to choose a color mixing mode which is prioritizing color stability and suppresses UV color.

Video.explanation: Use this attribute to describe generic functions related to video controls.

VideoBlendMode.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to choose a mode of blending of a video output.

VideoBoost_B.definition: Adjusts color boost blue of content.
VideoBoost_B.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to raise up intensity of green color in the media content.

VideoBoost_G.definition: Adjusts color boost green of content.
VideoBoost_G.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to raise up intensity of green color in the media content.

VideoBoost_R.definition: Adjusts color boost red of content.
VideoBoost_R.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to raise up intensity of red color in the media content.

VideoBrightness.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to set brightness of media content.

VideoCamera.explanation: Use this attribute to describe features related to a video camera.

VideoColorKey_B.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that provides media content color keying by blue color.

VideoContrast.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to set contrast of media content.

VideoEffectParameter.explanation: Use this attribute to describe generic video effects parameters.

VideoEffectType.definition: Selects dedicated effects which are used for media.
VideoEffectType.explanation: Use this attribute to describe generic video effects.

VideoHueShift.definition: Adjusts color hue shift of content.
VideoHueShift.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to set color hue shift of media content.

VideoKeyColor_G.definition: Adjusts green color for color keying.
VideoKeyColor_G.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that provides media content color keying by green color.

VideoKeyColor_R.definition: Adjusts red color for color keying.
VideoKeyColor_R.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that provides media content color keying by red color.

VideoKeyIntensity.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that adjusts the intensity of color keying.

VideoKeyTolerance.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that adjusts the tolerance value of color keying.

VideoSaturation.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to set saturation of media content.

VideoSoundVolume.explanation: Describes the audio volume function of a device.

WaveLengthCorrection.explanation: Use this attribute to describe a function that allows to adjust color mixing according to corresponding wavelengths in order to achieve same colors from multiple fixtures.

WhiteCount.definition: Controls if White LED is proportionally added to RGB.
WhiteCount.explanation: Some devices allow internal automatic intensity control of White LED  by the device, based on proportions of intensity of remaining LED emitters. Use this attribute to describe this behavior.

XYZ_X.definition: Defines a fixture’s x-coordinate within an XYZ coordinate system.
XYZ_X.explanation: Devices that can move straight in X-direction in space (opposite to pan or tilt circular movement) describe the movement with this attribute. A typical usage is left/right movement of a video-layer in space.

XYZ_Y.definition: Defines a fixture’s y-coordinate within an XYZ coordinate system.
XYZ_Y.explanation: Devices that can move straight in Y-direction in space (opposite to pan or tilt circular movement) describe the movement with this attribute. A typical usage is forward/backward movement of a video-layer in space.

XYZ_Z.definition: Defines a fixture‘s z-coordinate within an XYZ coordinate system.
XYZ_Z.explanation: Devices that can move straight in Z-direction in space (opposite to distance of a pan/tilt device) describe the movement with this attribute. A typical usage is up/down movement of a video-layer in space.

YellowMode.definition: Controls how Yellow is used within the fixture's yellow CMY-mixing feature.
YellowMode.explanation: Use this attribute to describe the mode of operation of the Yellow.

Zoom.definition: Controls the spread of the fixture's beam/spot.
Zoom.explanation: This attribute is used to adjust the beam angle of the light source.

ZoomMSpeed.definition: Movement speed of the fixture's zoom.
ZoomMSpeed.explanation: Use this attribute to set a speed of movement of zoom.

ZoomMode.definition: Changes modes of the fixture´s zoom.
ZoomMode.explanation: Use this to describe the possibility to set different zoom modes, like beam mode or a spot mode.

ZoomModeBeam.explanation: On devices with a Zoom which can be set to various types of projections, use this attribute to describe a Zoom mode with a beamy, hot-spoty type of projection.

ZoomModeSpot.explanation: On devices with a Zoom which can be set to various types of projections, use this attribute to describe a Zoom mode with a flat projection field definition.

ZoomReset.explanation: This attribute is describing a function that allows the operator to trigger an internal reset of the fixture's zoom lenses or elements.
